title: Single-Sign On Extensions (com.apple.extensiblesso)
description: Single-Sign On Extension settings. User-level payload support for macOS 11.x and later.

ExtensionIdentifier.title: Extension Identifier
ExtensionIdentifier.description: The bundle identifier of the app extension that performs single sign-on (SSO) for the specified URLs. Enter com.apple.AppSSOKerberos.KerberosExtension to use Apple's Kerberos SSO extension.

TeamIdentifier.title: Team Identifier
TeamIdentifier.description: The team identifier of the app extension. This key is required on macOS and ignored elsewhere.

Hosts.description: An array of host names or domain names that can be authenticated through the app extension. Required for Credential payloads. Ignored for Redirect payloads.

Realm.description: The realm name for Credential payloads. This value should be properly capitalized. This key is ignored for Redirect payloads.

URLs.description: The realm name for Credential payloads. This value should be properly capitalized. This key is ignored for Redirect payloads.

ExtensionData.title: Kerberos Extension Data
ExtensionData.description: Used by the Apple built-in Kerberos extension.

allowAutomaticLogin.title: Allow Automatic Login
allowAutomaticLogin.description: If false, passwords are not allowed to be saved to the keychain.

allowPasswordChange.title: Allow Password Change
allowPasswordChange.description: If false, disables password changes. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

cacheName.title: Cache Name
cacheName.description: The GSS name of the Kerberos cache to use. Rarely set by an administrator.

certificateUUID.title: Certificate UUID
certificateUUID.description: The PayloadUUID of a PKINIT certificate.

credentialBundleIdACL.title: Credential Bundle ID ACL
credentialBundleIdACL.description: A list of bundle IDs allowed to access the ticket-granting ticket (TGT).

credentialUseMode.title: Credential Use Mode
credentialUseMode.description: This setting affects how the Kerberos Extension credential is used by other processes. Available in macOS 11 and later.

customUsernameLabel.title: Custom Username Label
customUsernameLabel.description: The custom user name label used in the Kerberos extension instead of "Username". For example, "Company ID". Available on macOS 11 and later.

delayUserSetup.title: Delay User Setup
delayUserSetup.description: If true, doesn't prompt the user to setup the Kerberos extension until either the administrator enables it with the app-sso tool or a Kerberos challenge is received. Available in macOS 11 and later.

helpText.title: Help Text
helpText.description: The text to be displayed to the user at the bottom of the Kerberos login window. It can be used to display help information or disclaimer text. Available in iOS 14 and later and macOS 11 and later.

isDefaultRealm.title: Is Default Realm
isDefaultRealm.description: This property specifies it is the default realm if there is more than one Kerberos extension configuration.

includeManagedAppsInBundleIdACL.title: Include Managed Apps in Bundle ID ACL
includeManagedAppsInBundleIdACL.description: If true, the Kerberos extension will allow only managed apps to access and use the credential. This is in addition to the credentialBundleIDACL, if it is specified. Available in iOS 14 and later.

monitorCredentialsCache.title: Monitor Credential Cache
monitorCredentialsCache.description: If false, the credential is requested on the next matching Kerberos challenge or network state change. If the credential is expired or missing, a new one will be created. Available in macOS 11 and later.

principalName.title: Principal Name
principalName.description: The principal (aka username) to use. You do not need to include the realm.

pwChangeURL.title: Password Change URL
pwChangeURL.description: This URL will launch in the user's default web browser when they initiate a password change. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwNotificationDays.title: Password Notification Days
pwNotificationDays.description: The number of days prior to password expiration when a notification of password expiration will be sent to the user. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwExpireOverride.title: Password Expiration Override
pwExpireOverride.description: The number of days that passwords can be used on this domain. For most domains, this can be calculated automatically. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwReqComplexity.title: Password Requirement Complexity
pwReqComplexity.description: If true, passwords must meet Active Directory's definition of "complex". Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwReqHistory.title: Password Requirement History
pwReqHistory.description: The number of prior passwords that cannot be re-used on this domain. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwReqLength.title: Password Requirement Length
pwReqLength.description: The minimum length of passwords on the domain. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwReqMinAge.title: Password Requirement Minimum Age
pwReqMinAge.description: The minimum age of passwords before they can be changed on this domain. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

pwReqText.title: Password Requirement Text
pwReqText.description: The text version of the domain's password requirements. Only for use if pwReqComplexity or pwReqLength aren't specified. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

replicationTime.title: Replication Time
replicationTime.description: The time, in seconds, required to replicate changes in the Active Directory domain. The Kerberos extension will use this when checking password age after a change. Available in macOS 11 and later.

requireTLSForLDAP.title: Require TLS for LDAP
requireTLSForLDAP.description: Require that LDAP connections use TLS. Available in macOS 11 and later.

requireUserPresence.title: Require User Presence
requireUserPresence.description: If true, requires the user to provide Touch ID, Face ID or their passcode to access the keychain entry.

siteCode.title: Site Code
siteCode.description: The name of the Active Directory site the Kerberos extension should use. Most administrators will never need to modify this value, as the Kerberos extension can normally find the site automatically.

syncLocalPassword.title: Sync Local Password
syncLocalPassword.description: If false, disables password sync. Note that this will not work if the user is logged in with a mobile account. Available in macOS 10.15 and later.

useSiteAutoDiscovery.title: Use Site Auto Discovery
useSiteAutoDiscovery.description: If false, the Kerberos extension doesn't automatically use LDAP and DNS to determine its AD site name.
